intro: Silene hornemannii, commonly known as the Hornemann's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Silene hornemannii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
